Hence, 1/52 is indeed the right probability. None of the other options seem to fit. Option G is 1/13, which would be the probability if we were looking for the probability of drawing a heart, for example. Because there are 13 hearts in a deck. Similarly, if we wanted the probability of drawing the ace of any suit, like either hearts, diamonds, clubs, or spades, the probability would still be 1/13 because there are 13 aces in total, each belonging to different suits. But in our case, we're specifically looking for the ace of diamonds, which is one specific card among 52. So, yeah, it definitely reduces to 1/52. I don't see any reason to doubt this conclusion. Maybe someone could argue that since the deck is shuffled, does that affect the probability? But no, shuffling doesn't change the fact that each card has an equal chance of being anywhere in the deck. For example, the probability of the ace of diamonds being in the first position is 1/52, the same as it being in the second position, third, etc., all the way until the last position. So, regardless of where it is in the deck, its probability remains the same. Another perspective could be considering that once a card is removed or taken out, the probability changes, but in this case, we're drawing one card without removing any others.
